comment: Professor Kevin's class is clear and engaging, with a focus on Excel and Microsoft Access. Exams are flexible, being open book and no lockdown browser. he keeps lectures lively with humor and stories from his  work at Cox. getting at least a 'B' should be the least for this class. I wish he taught more information system classes.

This class is not a Comms class, it is a Microsoft excel class. Lectures are extremely repetitive and boring. If you are not proficient in Microsoft Excel, you will fail. If you can find away around this class or at least this teacher, I would highly recommend you do so.
He was a great professor. I truly enjoyed attending his class because he was funny. This class wasn't necessarily hard, but it is time consuming delegate your time wisely.

The class wasn't super hard but it was odd taking a quiz, not knowing what you did wrong, and then immediately taking a test and still not knowing what you did wrong. I genuinely have no idea what I learned because I don't know what I didn't learn. Can be a bit harsh when grading papers. Really funny guy though and might give extra credit.

I loved taking Professor Treanor! The class wasn't hard. Quizzes are the hardest part but make up a small part of your grade. Open book tests and 2 case studies. Worst part of the class was a group project with incompetent classmates. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he offered extra credit on certain days when attendance was low. Loved his class!

Four open book exams; 3 online no lockdown, 1 online person. Very easy. Two four page case studies, five quizzes. Quizzes are harder than exams. Chill teacher. One annoying group project w/ 20 page paper. Overall would take again.

Professor Treanor let me retake an exam when he knew that I had some stuff going on at home. Super kind and genuinely cares about his students. Answers emails pretty fast. Group project was pretty long, but he grades very fairly. If you need to take this class I definitely recommend him!

Kevin was a great professor and has a vast amount of knowledge within his respected field. If you take his IS 3100 class you are bound to leave smarter then you entered and having learned something new. He's very kind and is always easy to contact outside of class, responds to emails quickly. I highly recommend him for IS 3100.

Professor Treanor is great! The material is boring, but its obvious that he actually cares about his students and the course. Three exams that are open book (50 questions, 50 minutes)- There are also 3 case studies, 6 quizzes and a group project. Seems like a lot, but it isn't bad. He gives GREAT feedback & attendance is taken every class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: A lot of work to do in this class. Case analysis assignments, open booked tests, closed book/note quizzes, and a final group project/presentation. The open book tests seem easy but if you don't know the material, you won't be able to find the answers in time. If you do the work, you'll do fine.

He was a great teacher. After this semester tests will not be open book, so be warned. He has real world experience and uses it. His lectures can get mind numbing, but I am not in the major. Would take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Easy group project, nice professor. 3 easy papers on interesting topics.( literally answer questions, not a legit research paper). laid back. quizzes every now and then. 3 tests, open note, open book. Never went to class and passed with a 96. just do your work and stay on top of it!
